page.title: 17Recreation
page.content: The number of families taking an annual holiday seems to be influenced by the high cost of living at present for,while 95% of a survey of 175 local families had a holiday in 1983 the figure was reduced to 85% in 1984 and, although perhaps plans are still not made for 1985,only 73% claim to be taking one this year. The proportion of those taking a UK holiday to those going abroad remains constant at 2:1.In Europe,Spain is most popular with France as second choice. Each year a few families travel longer distances though visiting relatives is sometimes the reason. Self-catering is the most popular type of accommodation with hotels being second.Caravanning or camping is enjoyed by some. Day outings by car to the seaside, London or the pleasure parks are taken.
